title: Locking handle directions in Fontlab
content:
There’s a BCP function in Fontlab that I’m having trouble figuring out. Somehow, and I have yet to figure it out, I am creating handles that can only be extended directly out from their node. This is very useful, except that I have no clue how I am creating these nodes/handles and sometimes have to take the handles off of the node to change it. What’s going on?

 [‹ Importing potrace/ghostscript eps files into Fontlab](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119055032/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41976 "Go to previous forum topic") [Magazine dimensions changing with digital images? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119055032/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41943 "Go to next forum topic")
author: James Puckett

comments.content:
Right-click on node and enable “Fixed BCP direction”.

A.

Weren’t pink/purple nodes tangent nodes, or straight to curve ones?
